page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: FARMING. Much of the area is covered by farmland.Most of this is used for growing fruit and vegetables.When these are ready for harvesting,these farms are open for the public to "pick your own".Strawberries, raspberries,red and blackcurrants, gooseberries and apples as well as runner beans,broad beans,and peas are grown on these farms. Some of the produce is sent to market, but "pick your own" suits both the farmer and the customer as it cuts out the middle-man.The housewife gets really fresh fruit and vegetables,and they are much cheaper. A firm of Landscape gardeners is kept very busy,especially in the bigger houses,maintaining fencing and footpaths,and planning gardens. One farm keeps sheep.
